Mike Kelly wrote:
> 
> Hmm.. you could at least give him a decent HTTP lib to work from.
> Although I suppose you write that from scratch as well, right?
> 

An awful lot of what folks are trying to do with REST can be modeled as
HTML applications on a shared hosting account.  Most of the REST
literature leaves these folks with the impression that REST is so
complex that it can't be done without benefit of a framework, but this
is not the case, and often leads to the simplest of concepts becoming
complicated beyond reason (not to mention missing the point of REST).

-Eric
